jx.jx_en_mean: (Christian Theology)the covenant between God and Israel in the Old Testament
jx.jx_cn_mean: (基督教神学)旧约（《圣经•旧约》中上帝和以色列人的协约）

jx.jx_en_mean: (Christian Theology)the covenant between God and the followers of Christ
jx.jx_cn_mean: (基督教神学)新约（上帝和耶稣的追随者的协约）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, present participle of covenir 'agree', from Latin convenire (see convene)

entry.tran: (受法律约束的)协约，契约，合同
entry.def: A covenant is a formal written agreement between two or more people or groups of people which is recognized in law.

example.ex: ...the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.
example.tran: 《公民权利和政治权利国际公约》

entry.tran: (定期付款的)书面承诺;(尤指向慈善机构定期捐款的)契约
entry.def: A covenant is a formal written promise to pay a sum of money each year for a fixed period, especially to a charity.

example.ex: If you make regular gifts through a covenant we can reclaim the income tax which you have already paid on this money.
example.tran: 如果你签订契约定期捐赠，那么我们可以要求返还你这笔钱上交的所得税。

means.word_mean: 1. a signed written agreement between two or more parties (nations) to perform some action
2. (Bible) an agreement between God and his people in which God makes certain promises and requires certain behavior from them in return
2. enter into a covenant or formal agreement;

sentences.sentence: "They covenanted with Judas for 30 pieces of silver"
"The nations covenanted to fight terrorism around the world"
